com.apstrata.client.java.connection
Class TokenController

java.lang.Object
  com.apstrata.client.java.connection.TokenController

public class TokenController
extends java.lang.Object

The TokenController is the orchestrator that handles refreshing and renewing of an Apstrata authentication token. The main entry point to the orchestrator instance is the startTokenManagement() method, which triggers the creation and scheduling of a new instance of TokenRegenerateTask, which is ran immediately then ran again at the rate specified by TokenController.REGENERATE (seconds). When ran, the TokenRegenerateTask instances asks the orchestrator instance to reset(), which leads to:

  • Resetting the timers (TokenController.startTime and TokenController.endTime). The timers are respectively used to determine when to start counting for refreshing a token, and when to determine that a new token needs to be generated
  • The invocation of startTokenRenewTask() that creates and schedule a new instance of TokenRenewTask

Constructor Summary
TokenController(TokenConnection connection, long renew, long regenerate, double renewalThreshold)
           
 
Method Summary
 void startTokenManagement()
          This method trigger the whole refresh/renew authentication token process.
 void stopTokenManagement()
          Invoke this method to stop renewing and regenerating authentication tokens
